channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pothole on windyridge road by red rower turning by post box, 22nd November
item.description:
Pothole on windyridge road by red rower turning by post box. It has been here for a few weeks and the pothole is getting bigger.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Windyridge Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Barrier blocking pavement, 22nd November
item.description:
These barriers have been here for almost 4 months now blocking the pavement for disabled people and families with a push chair getting past. There was a small hole in the p[ath which was filled in when the barriers were put in place and they have been there every since with no sign of any actual work being done to fix any problem that may still exist so they need to be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Recently a poor repair was reported and an attempt made to repair road surface. Defect has been overfilled with the result being that instead of hitting a dip in the road you now hit a hump., 22nd November
item.description:
There was a poorly repaired trench at the junction, in that there was a ridge around the repair and the repair was below the road surface. Not an enjoyable experience for cyclists. At attempt has been made to repair. It seems to me that the end result is that too much tarmac has been used, there is now a hump with a similar impact for the cyclist.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Belmont Avenue, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 22nd November
item.description:
20/11/23 FixMyStreet rcvd, passed from by Cheltenham BC - Drain opposite school on Battledown Approach totally blocked. - It is the upper sotrm drain of the set opposite Holy Apostles School. Is choked with leaves and mud etc. Not helped by SUVs parking on it at school start and end times.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Permanently parked camper van, 22nd November
item.description:
There is a camper van parked here since the last few months and hasn't moved blocking two parking spaces. It looks like someone is living in it as it has stuff underneath.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Street, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Dropped pavement is too high., 22nd November
item.description:
The dropped pavement outside 13, Lichfield Drive is too high. I feel it is damaging my car every time I drive over it into my drive. I moved into this property 4 weeks ago, so this issue has been there since I moved in. I don't know when the pavement was dropped originally. Is it possible to have this dropped further? Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Lichfield Drive, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This is a 36cm wide pothole, 7cm deep, 92cm from the kerb into the road., 22nd November
item.description:
The hole has gradually become larger over several years, starting as a crack in the tarmac. It is located in Albemarle Road in the road between the front of house numbers 25 and 25A. This area of Albemarle Road receives double traffic along the one lane due to parked cars on the other side. Therefore there is a lot of wear on that area of road and over the hole. The hole is likely to get larger as the winter frosts arrive. Myself, and my neighbour at no 25A, both turn onto the hole as we leave our drives.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albemarle Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 22nd November
item.description:
FixMyStreet This damaged sign has had a temporary alternative placed in front of it. I know it has been like that for 2 years, as my son repositioned the temporary sign when it was blown over in the wind before Christmas 2021! High time that Glos County Council sorted this out permanently, as it is an eyesore in a Conservation area.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Double mattress dumped, 22nd November
item.description:
Mattress been in road for weeks. Sofa that had also been dumped was removed but mattress was left behind.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 116, Hesters Way Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 22nd November
item.description:
Hi I have reported the overgrown trees on Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe to tewkesbury council and they have informed me that they belong to you. The trees are on the road into winchcombe from cleeve hill, they are hugely under kept, leaning in the telegraph wires and sway dangerously in the wind. They are a danger to motorist, pedestrians and house owners and are in desperate need of cutting back.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage to pedestrian crossing signals, 22nd November
item.description:
Report has been made to Gloucestershire Police (incident 264 20-11-2023) - a male has driven into the pedestrian crossing signal. Please see attached photo. Please advise how you wish to proceed with this report and whether you are wishing to proceed with a formal Police investigation into this matter. If you can update soonest via 101 if you wish to proceed with any complaint. Our log will be closed pending any further contact from yourselves. Many Thanks Glos Police Triage Team - Force Control Room

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clarence Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
